meanings.definition: More lordly in manner or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The king's throne looked even lordlier with the golden trim.
meanings.sent2: The castle on the hill appeared lordlier than the humble cottages below.
meanings.sent3: The cat strutted around the house, acting lordlier than the other pets.
meanings.sent4: The grand oak tree stood lordlier than all the other trees in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The queen's crown sparkled, making her look even lordlier than before.

meanings.definition: In a manner befitting a lord.
meanings.sent1: He walked lordlier than usual, with his head held high.
meanings.sent2: She spoke lordlier than anyone else at the royal banquet.
meanings.sent3: The dog barked lordlier than expected, surprising everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The music played softly, setting the scene for the guests to enter lordlier.
meanings.sent5: The knight bowed deeply, acting even lordlier in front of the queen.
